solution_line_template: If Lexie takes {lexie_time_per_mile} minutes to run a mile, Celia takes {lexie_time_per_mile}/{speed_multiplier} = <<{lexie_time_per_mile}/{speed_multiplier}={celia_time_per_mile}>>{celia_time_per_mile} minutes to run the same distance since she is twice as fast.

Celia takes {celia_time_per_mile} minutes to run one mile so it will take {celia_time_per_mile}*{distance_miles} = <<{celia_time_per_mile}*{distance_miles}={total_time_celia}>>{total_time_celia} minutes to run {distance_miles} miles.
